paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the BRCA2 gene along with penetrance data from the study.

patients.phenotype: Left breast cancer, underwent total mastectomy of left breast and risk-reducing mastectomy of right breast.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Left breast cancer, underwent total mastectomy of left breast.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Case 4 was a 45-year-old woman with a germline BRCA2 p.I1065fs variant, and case 5 was a 69-year-old woman with a germline BRCA1 c.5278-1 G > A variant; both variants were reported as pathogenic.

functional_data.summary: No specific functional data provided for this variant.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on pathogenic classification.
variants.additional_notes: This variant was associated with a significant clonal expansion in normal breast tissue.
key_quotes: Case 4 was a 45-year-old woman with a germline BRCA2 p.I1065fs variant.

patients.phenotype: Past left breast cancer, underwent contralateral risk-reducing mastectomy.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Past left breast cancer, underwent contralateral risk-reducing mastectomy.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on pathogenic classification.
